allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Implement VICI dialer integration for Medicare eligibility workflow

Complete implementation of VICI dialer mock system with automatic disposition
sending after classification. Simplified to 4-tool workflow as specified.

VICI Integration:
- Created VICI type definitions (vici.types.ts) with comprehensive types for
  dispositions (SALE, NQI, NI, NA, AM, DC, B, DAIR), call states, agent phones,
  callbacks, and business hours configuration
- Implemented VICI service layer (vici.service.ts) with disposition sending,
  callback scheduling, and retry logic with exponential backoff
- Created VICI mock server (port 3004) to simulate dialer system for testing
- Added VICI port and disposition constants to constants.ts

Workflow Simplification:
- Removed classify_user and save_classification_result from tool router
- Enhanced classify_and_save_user to automatically send VICI dispositions:
  * QUALIFIED â†’ SALE disposition
  * NOT_QUALIFIED â†’ NQI disposition
- Single atomic operation: classify â†’ save â†’ send disposition to VICI
- Updated tool definitions endpoint to expose only 4 tools

Infrastructure Updates:
- Updated package.json with dev:vici script
- Modified dev:all to run all 5 servers (Lead, UserData, Classification, VICI, VAPI)
- Fixed logger imports (default export instead of named export)

Testing:
- Verified complete workflow end-to-end
- Tested QUALIFIED case: John Smith â†’ SALE disposition sent to VICI
- Tested NOT_QUALIFIED case: David Wilson â†’ NQI disposition sent to VICI
- Confirmed VICI server receives and tracks all dispositions
- All 5 servers running successfully on ports 3000-3004

Based on AlexAI_Workflow_Full_Detailed.md and Task.txt requirements.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Complete Medicare eligibility compliance fixes

Updated documentation and comments to fully align with Task.txt and
AlexAI_Workflow_Full_Detailed.md specifications. All code was already
correctly implemented for Medicare eligibility - only documentation needed
updates to remove outdated bio/genetic references.

Documentation Updates:
- Updated README.md to clarify Medicare eligibility focus throughout
- Changed project description from "bio and genetic data" to "Medicare eligibility"
- Updated architecture section to list all 5 servers (including VICI)
- Simplified tool list to 4-tool workflow (removed classify_user and save_classification_result)
- Fixed curl examples to use medicareData instead of bioData
- Added comprehensive classification criteria explanation:
  * Medicare plan levels (Advantage/C: 40pts, B: 30pts, A/D: 20pts)
  * Colorblindness requirement (40pts, mandatory)
  * Age scoring (65+: 20pts)
  * 80+ point threshold for QUALIFIED
- Added VICI integration details (QUALIFIEDâ†’SALE, NOT_QUALIFIEDâ†’NQI)
- Updated .env.example with VAPI_ASSISTANT_ID and NGROK_URL fields

Code Updates:
- Fixed comment in classificationCrm.server.ts (line 221) from "bio and genetic data"
  to "Medicare data and eligibility criteria"

Verification:
- All TypeScript code already correctly implemented Medicare-specific logic
- No bio/genetic fields in userData.types.ts (already Medicare-focused)
- Classification logic properly checks Medicare plan + colorblindness + age
- constants.ts clean (only QUALIFIED/NOT_QUALIFIED)
- Tool definitions correct (4-tool workflow)

Testing Completed:
- John Smith (+972501234001): Score 100 â†’ QUALIFIED â†’ SALE disposition sent
- David Wilson (+12025551005): Score 20 â†’ NOT_QUALIFIED â†’ NQI disposition sent
- VICI mock server confirmed receipt of both dispositions
- All 5 servers running successfully on ports 3000-3004

Project now 100% compliant with specifications.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
